[LEXICON]: Archaic terms ("the thing" for unspecified entities) and unclear abbreviations (e.g., "oeuvre" without context). - [SPELLING/TYPO] Potential typo ("stuff" instead of "staff" or similar).

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from bureaucratic navigation to descriptive battlefield scenes (e.g., Meaux graves).
[STRUCTURE]: Minor tangents (e.g., critique of American embassies) slightly disrupt focus.

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally awkward sentence structure (e.g., long compound sentences).

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between war descriptions, bureaucratic interactions, and train observations.
[CLARITY]: Minor thematic jumps (e.g., hatred for Germans feels tangential).
